Petani Minta Cukai Rokok Hanya Naik 15%, Ini Jawaban Kemenkeu
04 Nov 2019, 07:33 by Vadhia Lidyana


Foto: Rifkianto Nugroho

Jakarta - Asosiasi Petani Tembakau Indonesia (APTI) Jawa Barat (Jabar) sejak pagi hingga siang hari ini menggelar unjuk rasa di depan kantor Kementerian Keuangan. Dalam aksi tersebut, APTI Jabar juga menyampaikan keberatannya mengenai kenaikan cukai rokok rata-rata 23%, dan harga jual eceran (HJE) rata-rata 35% yang diatur dalam Peraturan Menteri Keuangan (PMK) nomor 152 tahun 2019.Pengurus DPC APTI Jabar, Didi Rohmana mengatakan, pihaknya meminta agar pemerintah mempertimbangkan kembali kenaikan tersebut. Menurutnya, yang ideal kenaikannya sebesar 10-15%."Yang pertama memperhatikan kenaikan cukai, ini perlu dipertimbangkan, jangan terlalu tinggi sampai 23%. Kami minta 10-15%. Kata Pak Dirjen itu di dalam proses pembahasan di tingkat menteri," ujar Pengurus DPC APTI Jabar, Didi Rohmana kepada detikcom di kantor Kemenkeu, Jakarta, Senin (4/11/2019).Menjawab hal tersebut, Direktur Jenderal Bea dan Cukai Kemenkeu Heru Pambudi mengatakan, pada penerapannya kenaikan cukai rokok bervariasi. Misalnya, kenaikan cukai rokok untuk jenis Sigaret Kretek Tangan (SKT) dimulai dari 12%. Kebijakan tersebut dilakukan untuk memperhatikan nasib tenaga kerja dan petani di industri padat karya tersebut."Kalau kita perhatikan PMK 152 itu meskipun average-nya adalah 23% dan 35%, tapi kalau kita lihat detailnya itu variatif. Pemerintah betul-betul telah memperhatikan kemampuan antar golongan, kemampuan antar jenis rokok. Sehingga kenaikan cukai rokok jenis SKT start-nya dari 12%. Itu membuktikan bahwa pemerintah memperhatikan tenaga kerja yang di industri padat karya, makanya kenaikan tarif SKT itu terendah. Ini berbeda dengan yang mesin, yang relatuif lebih tinggi," papar Heru. Menurutnya, kenaikan cukai rokok memang difokuskan untuk mengendalikan konsumsi dan produksi rokok. Namun, pemerintah tetap memperhatikan nasib industri dan tenaga kerja."Tujuan dari pada kebijakan itu supaya pengendalian konsumsi dan produksi tetap dijalankan, tetapi di sisi lain tenaga kerja juga diperhatikan. Kalau diramu dengan tadi, yang aspirasi dari pada petani, dengan demikian pemerintah sebenarnya telah mengharmonisasi beberapa kepentingan yaitu petani, tenaga kerja, industri itu sendiri, dan keempat kesehatan," jelas Heru. Farmers Ask for Excise on Cigarettes Only Up by 15%, This Is the Answer of the Ministry of Finance
04 Nov 2019, 07:33 by Vadhia Lidyana


Photo: Rifkianto Nugroho

Jakarta - The Indonesian Tobacco Farmers Association (APTI) West Java (West Java) has been holding a demonstration in front of the Ministry of Finance from the morning until noon. In this action, APTI Jabar also raised its objections regarding an increase in cigarette excise by an average of 23%, and an average retail selling price (HJE) of 35% as stipulated in the Minister of Finance Regulation (PMK) number 152 in 2019. The Executive Board of DPC APTI Jabar, Didi Rohmana said that he requested that the government reconsider the increase. According to him, the ideal increase is 10-15%. "The first to pay attention to the increase in excise duty, this needs to be considered, not too high to 23%. We ask for 10-15%. The Director General said in the discussion process at the ministerial level," said West Java APTI DPC executive Didi Rohmana told AFP at the Ministry of Finance office, Jakarta, Monday (11/04/2019). Answering this, the Director General of Customs and Excise of the Ministry of Finance Heru Pambudi said, the implementation of cigarette excise tax increases varied. For example, the increase in cigarette excise for Hand Clove Cigarettes (SKT) starts at 12%. The policy is carried out to pay attention to the fate of workers and farmers in the labor-intensive industry. "If we look at PMK 152 even though the average is 23% and 35%, but if we look at the details it is varied. The government has really paid attention to the inter class, ability between types of cigarettes, so that the excise tax increase for SKT-type cigarettes starts from 12%, which proves that the government pays attention to workers in labor-intensive industries, so the increase in SKT rates is the lowest, this is different from machines, which are relatively higher. , "said Heru. According to him, the increase in cigarette excise tax was indeed focused on controlling cigarette consumption and production. However, the government still pays attention to the fate of industry and labor. "The purpose of the policy is to keep consumption and production control still carried out, but on the other hand labor is also given attention. If mixed with the earlier aspirations of farmers, the government has actually been "harmonizing several interests, namely farmers, labor, the industry itself, and the fourth health," Heru explained.
